label: Mapped read count
tooltip: The number of reads mapped to this sequence. A higher read count suggests greater confidence in the sequence.

label: Mean read depth
tooltip: The mean depth of reads mapped to this sequence â€“ a depth of 30X indicates high confidence in the sequence.

label: Mapped read (%)
tooltip: Percentage of total reads that were mapped to this sequence. This can indicate what proportion of sample material this sequence represents.

label: 30X coverage (%)
tooltip: Percentage of this sequence with a depth of mapped reads of 30X or greater.

label: 30X coverage flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the 30X depth coverage percentage of this sequence is >= 90%; orange if between 75% and 90%; and red if < 75%.

label: Mean read depth flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the mean depth of reads mapped to this sequence is > 500; orange if between 100 and 500; and red if < 100.

label: Mapped read count flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the number of reads mapped to this sequence is > 1000; orange if between 200 and 1000; and red if < 200.

label: Target organism flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the preliminary homology blast search of the sequence is predicted to be >= 90% identical to the sample organism targeted; orange if predicted to be < 90% identical to the sample organism targeted; and red if it is not predicted to be the sample organism targeted.

label: Target size flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the sequence length is within 20% of the target amplicon size; orange if between 20% and 40%; and red if 40% smaller or larger than expected.

label: Mapped reads length flag
tooltip: Flag is green if number of mapped reads whose lengths are at least 90% of the reference length is >=200; orange if between 50 and 200; and red if < 50.

label: Mean mapping quality flag
tooltip: Flag is green if the mean mapping quality of reads to this sequence is >= 30; orange if between 10 and 30; and red if < 10.

label: Total confidence score
tooltip: The confidence score is based on a scoring system which assigns different weight to each flag colour. A higher score indicates a higher confidence in the sequence.

label: Normalised confidence score
tooltip: The normalised confidence score is a value between 0 and 1 that is calculated by normalising the confidence score to the maximum possible score for this sequence. A value of 1 indicates the sequence with highest confidence.
